author: Nadeen Ebrahim, CNN
description: When oil exporters meet on Tuesday to decide on whether to raise output, they'll have to take into account a looming global recession that threatens to slash demand for their crude and diminish their ability to control its price.
title: Why OPEC may not have the answer to high oil prices
content:

description: Oil prices slipped more than $1 a barrel on Monday as global economic concerns depressed the oil demand outlook while investors eyed the G7 meeting this week for possible moves on Russian oil exports and a revival of the Iran nuclear deal.
title: Oil slides more than $1 as G7 debate Iran nuclear deal, Russia - Reuters
content: SINGAPORE, June 27 (Reuters) - Oil prices slipped more than $1 a barrel on Monday as global economic concerns depressed the oil demand outlook while investors eyed the G7 meeting this week for possib… [+2274 chars]

description: Oil investors are focusing on "recession - the R word," energy historian Yergin said in a CNBC discussion about oil prices that have been dropping.
title: Oil prices are coming down because looming economic growth risks outweigh tight supplies, energy expert Daniel Yergin says
content:
Oil prices have been pulling back recently as tight supplies in the market have been overshadowed by economic growth worries as Russia ramps-up tensions with Europe and as the
